intro: Leptospermum oxycedrus, commonly known as the narrow-leaved tea tree, is a species of flowering plant in the family Ericaceae. It is native to southeastern Australia, particularly found in the coastal regions of New South Wales and Victoria. The plant is characterized by its small, narrow leaves and produces clusters of white or pale pink flowers. It is often used in horticulture for its ornamental value and has some traditional uses in herbal medicine. The plant prefers well-drained soils and is typically found in coastal heathlands and dry sclerophyll forests.
